trans-unit.source: Create ContentKeys with REST
trans-unit.target: Create ContentKeys with REST

trans-unit.source: Learn how to create content keys that provide secure access to Assets.
trans-unit.target: Learn how to create content keys that provide secure access to Assets.

trans-unit.source: Media Services enables you to create new and deliver encrypted assets.
trans-unit.target: Media Services enables you to create new and deliver encrypted assets.

trans-unit.source: A ContentKey provides secure access to your Assets.
trans-unit.target: A ContentKey provides secure access to your Assets.

trans-unit.source: When you create a new asset (for example, before you upload files), you can specify the following encryption options: StorageEncrypted, CommonEncryptionProtected, or EnvelopeEncryptionProtected.
trans-unit.target: When you create a new asset (for example, before you upload files), you can specify the following encryption options: StorageEncrypted, CommonEncryptionProtected, or EnvelopeEncryptionProtected.

trans-unit.source: When you deliver assets to your clients, you can configure for assets to be dynamically encrypted with one of the following two encryptions: DynamicEnvelopeEncryption or DynamicCommonEncryption.
trans-unit.target: When you deliver assets to your clients, you can configure for assets to be dynamically encrypted with one of the following two encryptions: DynamicEnvelopeEncryption or DynamicCommonEncryption.

trans-unit.source: Encrypted assets have to be associated with ContentKeys.
trans-unit.target: Encrypted assets have to be associated with ContentKeys.

trans-unit.source: This article describes how to create a content key.
trans-unit.target: This article describes how to create a content key.

trans-unit.source: The following are general steps for generating content keys that you will associate with assets that you want to be encrypted.
trans-unit.target: The following are general steps for generating content keys that you will associate with assets that you want to be encrypted.

trans-unit.source: Randomly generate a 16-byte AES key (for common and envelope encryption) or a 32-byte AES key (for storage encryption).
trans-unit.target: Randomly generate a 16-byte AES key (for common and envelope encryption) or a 32-byte AES key (for storage encryption).

trans-unit.source: This will be the content key for your asset, which means all files associated with that asset will need to use the same content key during decryption.
trans-unit.target: This will be the content key for your asset, which means all files associated with that asset will need to use the same content key during decryption.

trans-unit.source: Call the <linkText>GetProtectionKeyId</linkText><title></title> and <linkText>GetProtectionKey</linkText><title></title> methods to get the correct X.509 Certificate that must be used to encrypt your content key.
trans-unit.target: Call the <linkText>GetProtectionKeyId</linkText><title></title> and <linkText>GetProtectionKey</linkText><title></title> methods to get the correct X.509 Certificate that must be used to encrypt your content key.

trans-unit.source: Encrypt your content key with the public key of the X.509 Certificate.
trans-unit.target: Encrypt your content key with the public key of the X.509 Certificate.

trans-unit.source: Media Services .NET SDK uses RSA with OAEP when doing the encryption.
trans-unit.target: Media Services .NET SDK uses RSA with OAEP when doing the encryption.

trans-unit.source: You can see an example in the <linkText>EncryptSymmetricKeyData function</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: You can see an example in the <linkText>EncryptSymmetricKeyData function</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: Create a checksum value (based on the PlayReady AES key checksum algorithm) calculated using the key identifier and content key.
trans-unit.target: Create a checksum value (based on the PlayReady AES key checksum algorithm) calculated using the key identifier and content key.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see the “PlayReady AES Key Checksum Algorithm” section of the PlayReady Header Object document located <linkText>here</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: For more information, see the “PlayReady AES Key Checksum Algorithm” section of the PlayReady Header Object document located <linkText>here</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: The following .NET example calculates the checksum using the GUID part of the key identifier and the clear content key.
trans-unit.target: The following .NET example calculates the checksum using the GUID part of the key identifier and the clear content key.

trans-unit.source: Create the Content key with the EncryptedContentKey (converted to base64-encoded string), ProtectionKeyId, ProtectionKeyType, ContentKeyType, and Checksum values you have received in previous steps.
trans-unit.target: Create the Content key with the EncryptedContentKey (converted to base64-encoded string), ProtectionKeyId, ProtectionKeyType, ContentKeyType, and Checksum values you have received in previous steps.

trans-unit.source: Associate the ContentKey entity with your Asset entity through the $links operation.
trans-unit.target: Associate the ContentKey entity with your Asset entity through the $links operation.

trans-unit.source: Note that examples that generate an AES key, encrypt the key, and calculate the checksum have been omitted from this topic.
trans-unit.target: Note that examples that generate an AES key, encrypt the key, and calculate the checksum have been omitted from this topic.

trans-unit.source: Only the examples that show how to interact with Media Services are provided.
trans-unit.target: Only the examples that show how to interact with Media Services are provided.

trans-unit.source: When working with the Media Services REST API, the following considerations apply:
trans-unit.target: When working with the Media Services REST API, the following considerations apply:

trans-unit.source: When accessing entities in Media Services, you must set specific header fields and values in your HTTP requests.
trans-unit.target: When accessing entities in Media Services, you must set specific header fields and values in your HTTP requests.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see <linkText>Setup for Media Services REST API Development</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: For more information, see <linkText>Setup for Media Services REST API Development</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: After successfully connecting to https://media.windows.net, you will receive a 301 redirect specifying another Media Services URI.
trans-unit.target: After successfully connecting to https://media.windows.net, you will receive a 301 redirect specifying another Media Services URI.

trans-unit.source: You must make subsequent calls to the new URI as described in <linkText>Connecting to Media Services using REST API</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: You must make subsequent calls to the new URI as described in <linkText>Connecting to Media Services using REST API</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: The following example shows how to retrieve the ProtectionKeyId, a certificate thumbprint, for the certificate you must use when encrypting your content key.
trans-unit.target: The following example shows how to retrieve the ProtectionKeyId, a certificate thumbprint, for the certificate you must use when encrypting your content key.

trans-unit.source: Do this step to make sure that you already have the appropriate certificate on your machine.
trans-unit.target: Do this step to make sure that you already have the appropriate certificate on your machine.

trans-unit.source: After you have retrieved the X.509 certificate and used its public key to encrypt your content key, create a ContentKey entity and set its property values accordingly.
trans-unit.target: After you have retrieved the X.509 certificate and used its public key to encrypt your content key, create a ContentKey entity and set its property values accordingly.

trans-unit.source: One of the values that you must set when create the content key is the type.
trans-unit.target: One of the values that you must set when create the content key is the type.

trans-unit.source: Choose from one of the following values.
trans-unit.target: Choose from one of the following values.

trans-unit.source: The following example shows how to create a ContentKey with a ContentKeyType set for storage encryption ("1") and the ProtectionKeyType set to "0" to indicate that the protection key Id is the X.509 certificate thumbprint.
trans-unit.target: The following example shows how to create a ContentKey with a ContentKeyType set for storage encryption ("1") and the ProtectionKeyType set to "0" to indicate that the protection key Id is the X.509 certificate thumbprint.
